body.p:
I am very much in your debt several of your
kind favors remain unanswered the last dated the
26th Ulto duly received with Feby occidents which I have
to inform you, are much over dayed. This parcel cont 6/3
tender “duty & enter” 2/2=8/5. Jany no's cont 7/. Dec 6/3. The cart trod in consequence of other works being in the parcels. I advise you to forward March by Mail directed to each party as follows
D Piza, S & G Benjamin, H Solomon, D David K Aaron, Montl. Mrs Hart /321
J Levy J Benjn/ Quebec / ?heimer & J F Joseph /Toronto/. In how many
numbers are the records women of Israel to be published & what is the
cost? The heavy postage will not permit the circulation of
such works here—tho I should be pleased to aid in the
more extended circulation of Miss Aguilars writings—best
I do not admit her right to escape from criticism—indeed
I never read a prettier specimen of cockney poetry than
appeared in a late number of the “Occident.” I agree with
you she is deserving of every encouragement and I sincerely
trust she receives her just reward in England, if not in
America. I notice your determination to complete
a translation of the bible & am endeavoring to procure for
your subscribers. Any when you expect its appearance and
in what time it will be completed. As you kindly
offer to dispose of two setts of our Polish Minhag they
will be dispatched per first opportunity—presuming you
can

can obtain a reasonable price for them. Your edition would
be taken in lieu thereof. My brother returned much
pleased with his trip after an absence of two months. So far
as I have enquired the following would take the Occident for
another year. Miss Hart, J Benjamins, Dr David, Ascher, Piza, Joseph
J Aaron & A A Cohen. H Solomon declines, others I have not heard from

As your Government appear to disposed to adopt the cheap
postage system of civilized countries it may be advisable to
forward all by mail—as the cost at present nearly
surpasses? the whole Amt of subscription. I see no reason why I should purduce subscribers in Canada at so expensive a rate

In a former letter you remarked upon the liberality of the
British Government in holding the Cornwall Canal allow me
to correct you by stating that all the public works, with the
exception of the Rideau Canal, are constructed at the sole
expense of Canada—tho the money is loaned in England
the interest is regularly paid & the principal not yet repudiated.

You are aware that our legislature is now in session—they
met on 28 Nov. All is quiet here, prosperous as ever & prospects
good as well in the country as in the city where the
improvements are not less than have been art? during
the last two years. Rents high, property daily increasing in value
preparation for building on a large scale—all denote the
happy effects of a stable government I wish we could be
tempted ?—but I assure you the ? of the
trader

winter is no bar to the enjoyment thereof. What attraction
you can find in the unsettled weather of your middle states
at one time burning under a ?—at another all the
communications with the surrounding world cut off by an awful
snow storm followed as usual by rain & the concequent
inundation of your streets. I say its strange state to exist
under so varied a climate as your “temperate regions.” We have had no
lack of snow & sleighing of course. Snow shoeing has become a very
fashionable exercise much indulged in by ladies. I am
endeavoring to have your work subscribed for by the library
of our legislature—if so acted I shall call upon Mr Ramsay for his
copy. Mr David & Doctor desire to be remembered
to you, as also Myer Solomon & all the members of our
family. Adolphia M & his lady are on ? to
three Rivers. The advocates for reform have resolved upon
not urging us to a division of the congregation—being ? probably
with the injury already committed by their peaks. It take little interest
in the state of shool matters, having tired of all the bickerings & broils
that so lamentably exist between the members of all
is inculcated—they follow in the train. Such is the religion of our
people—goodwill & clarity are not characteristics—no Christian
feeling. I hope the new Rabbi will prove a Benefactor
to this race—much time must elapse before he can act decisively
but I trust he will settle all differences. Sincerely yours
